body.p: “The callitriche is most forward a foot or more long with its delicate or pretty cup like whorls of leaves resting on the surface. I see no signs of a blossom. What is that narrow tooth-leafed 7 red stemmed plant which has grown nearly as much in the water? Crosswise. Then there is the cress next underway. Yet on the whole I think the columbine in the most favorable places about even with these. The latter have been less checked the last 4 or 5 days.”
